block.p: Bankruptcy as Church Strategy For officials of Boston's Roman Catholic Archdiocese, bankruptcy has emerged as a potentially attractive strategy for dealing with the hundreds of lawsuits it faces over sexual abuse by priests. It would, however, open the archdiocese's financial records.

United Mechanics Voting Again Mechanics at United Airlines will vote on a revised package of concessions intended to help the airline stay out of bankruptcy, and United said it would take advantage of a grace period to defer a $375 million payment on a loan that was due yesterday.

More Study vs. Quick Action As the Bush administration convenes a meeting to set its agenda for research on climate change, many experts who will attend say further study will only delay urgent action needed to avert serious harm.

Dual-Purpose U.S. Diplomacy The United States is pressing the European Union on membership for Turkey and Cyprus. American officials say the move comes from foreign policy considerations but some acknowledge it may be helpful in a war with Iraq.

Sink the Bismarck? Maybe Not The World War II sinking of the Bismarck remains a point of British pride. One small problem: new evidence suggests the story is wrong and the wounded ship was scuttled and not sunk by the British.

Shopping at Work Online retailers have seen a surge of sales the Monday after Thanksgiving as consumers go back to work and then go shopping online from the office. Early returns show that online sales are up briskly.
